ca.mcgill.ecse211.Project.Testing

Class Testing

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.Project.Testing.Testing

  • public class Testing
extends java.lang.Object
    This is our testing class where we can call multiple methods to test robot parameters and more
    Author:
    Mael

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDistance()
      Converting distance readings to an integer
      float getLeftRValue()
      return left light sensor values
      float getRightRValue()
      return right light sensor values
      void testDISTValue()
      Test Distance separating light sensors from wheels by having the robot reverse until it detects a black line then moving forwards the DIST parameter value.
      void testFaceTheta(double theta)
      Test the faceTheta method by having the robot tunr at a random angle then correcting itself to face at specified theta
      void testGoingStraight()
      Test if the robot is going perfectly forward by having it go forward the length of 14 tile sizes
      void testLeftBlackValue()
      Test the L value for a black line by having the robot turn on itself printing out left light sensor values.
      void testLeftWheelRadius()
      Test Wheel Radius by having the left wheel complete 5 turns and making sure that the orange piece placed at the end of the wheel is at the same orientation it started at.
      void testRightBlackValue()
      Test the R value for a black line by having the robot turn on itself printing out right light sensor values.
      void testRightWheelRadius()
      Test Wheel Radius by having the right wheel complete 5 turns and making sure that the orange piece placed at the end of the wheel is at the same orientation it started at.
      void testTrack()
      TEST Project.TRACK value to make sure it is correct by making the robot rotate on itself until it completes 6 turns if the robot is not in the same position as the one it started in the track is wrong and needs to be changed
      void testUsDistance()
      This method is to test the US sensor distance readings Used to get the target distance to start can scanning
      void testWeighing()
      Test the weighing method by continuously calling the getWeight method until the tester stops the robot

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • testTrack

        public void testTrack()
        TEST Project.TRACK value to make sure it is correct by making the robot rotate on itself until it completes 6 turns if the robot is not in the same position as the one it started in the track is wrong and needs to be changed

      • testUsDistance

        public void testUsDistance()
        This method is to test the US sensor distance readings Used to get the target distance to start can scanning

      • testWeighing

        public void testWeighing()
        Test the weighing method by continuously calling the getWeight method until the tester stops the robot

      • testFaceTheta

        public void testFaceTheta(double theta)
        Test the faceTheta method by having the robot tunr at a random angle then correcting itself to face at specified theta
        Parameters:
        theta -

      • getDistance

        public int getDistance()
        Converting distance readings to an integer
        Returns:
        integer

      • testDISTValue

        public void testDISTValue()
        Test Distance separating light sensors from wheels by having the robot reverse until it detects a black line then moving forwards the DIST parameter value. If the center of the wheels is not on the detected black line, the DIST value is wrong

      • testRightBlackValue

        public void testRightBlackValue()
        Test the R value for a black line by having the robot turn on itself printing out right light sensor values. Using EV3 control to copy these values, by placing them in excel the black R value is easily seen on a graph

      • testLeftBlackValue

        public void testLeftBlackValue()
        Test the L value for a black line by having the robot turn on itself printing out left light sensor values. Using EV3 control to copy these values, by placing them in excel the black L value is easily seen on a graph

      • testGoingStraight

        public void testGoingStraight()
        Test if the robot is going perfectly forward by having it go forward the length of 14 tile sizes

      • testLeftWheelRadius

        public void testLeftWheelRadius()
        Test Wheel Radius by having the left wheel complete 5 turns and making sure that the orange piece placed at the end of the wheel is at the same orientation it started at.

      • testRightWheelRadius

        public void testRightWheelRadius()
        Test Wheel Radius by having the right wheel complete 5 turns and making sure that the orange piece placed at the end of the wheel is at the same orientation it started at.

      • getRightRValue

        public float getRightRValue()
        return right light sensor values
        Returns:

      • getLeftRValue

        public float getLeftRValue()
        return left light sensor values
        Returns:
